channel.title: Georgios Konstantopoulos / @gakonst
channel.description: Twitter feed for: @gakonst. Generated by nitter.freedit.eu

item.title:
RT by @gakonst: "The All Core Devs process can be improved (as Tim Beiko recently suggested on the Consensus Layer call). We invite the community to weigh in on the Pectra retrospective with concrete suggestions.
Let’s allocate more resources to DevOps and Testing so we can confidently deliver major improvements more often — while still preserving the reliability Ethereum is known for."
One place I see a lot of inertia is having the right data to move forward on things! e.g. the bandwidth conversation - can we increase bandwidth requirements without significantly impacting Ethereum's decentralization? We run into this question and it's wild that we don't already have the data to say YES or NO
Right now @ethPandaOps has stepped up to gather some of that data but they're ALSO responsible for a lot of testing that goes into making sure the fork goes well. These two things are a lot of work and they're only one team!
There should be MANY teams working on creating neutral data sets that inform accelerationism and kill the argument before it turns into a bunch of unproductive internet arguments
item.dc:creator: @nixorokish
item.description:
"The All Core Devs process can be improved (as Tim Beiko recently suggested on the Consensus Layer call). We invite the community to weigh in on the Pectra retrospective with concrete suggestions.

Let’s allocate more resources to DevOps and Testing so we can confidently deliver major improvements more often — while still preserving the reliability Ethereum is known for."

One place I see a lot of inertia is having the right data to move forward on things! e.g. the bandwidth conversation - can we increase bandwidth requirements without significantly impacting Ethereum's decentralization? We run into this question and it's wild that we don't already have the data to say YES or NO

Right now @ethPandaOps has stepped up to gather some of that data but they're ALSO responsible for a lot of testing that goes into making sure the fork goes well. These two things are a lot of work and they're only one team!

There should be MANY teams working on creating neutral data sets that inform accelerationism and kill the argument before it turns into a bunch of unproductive internet arguments

item.title:
RT by @gakonst: Maybe this is the right time to say: In my opinion, for-profit motives and positive impact do not have to be in tension with each other at all.
I am very glad Ethereum has Paradigm. When we look back and trace why Ethereum won, they will have played a meaningful part.
eth/acc.
item.dc:creator: @adietrichs

item.title:

Full post here: https://www.paradigm.xyz/2025/01/ethereum-acceleration-1
item.dc:creator: @gakonst

item.title: R to @gakonst: Let's accelerate the World Computer, together.
item.dc:creator: @gakonst
item.description: Let's accelerate the World Computer, together.

item.title:
R to @gakonst: How is @paradigm contributing to the mission of Ethereum Acceleration?
We have EIPs, data analysis, and code to give.
We invite the research community to collaborate with us.
item.dc:creator: @gakonst
item.description:
How is @paradigm contributing to the mission of Ethereum Acceleration?

We have EIPs, data analysis, and code to give.

We invite the research community to collaborate with us.

item.title: R to @gakonst: There's low-hanging fruit we could go after. Let's do more, faster.
item.dc:creator: @gakonst
item.description: There's low-hanging fruit we could go after. Let's do more, faster.

item.title:
R to @gakonst: We can move faster by deciding to evolve the protocol with ambition, and not ossify.
We can do better than N-of-N (5 CL + 5 EL!) clients coming to consensus before new upgrades.
We can level up ACD.
We can allocate more resources to Devops & Testing.
item.dc:creator: @gakonst
item.description:
We can move faster by deciding to evolve the protocol with ambition, and not ossify.

We can do better than N-of-N (5 CL + 5 EL!) clients coming to consensus before new upgrades.

We can level up ACD.

We can allocate more resources to Devops & Testing.

item.title:
R to @gakonst: We haven't yet the fundamental limits of what we can do.
Ethereum should reach the efficient frontier of what’s possible before arguing about how we would choose between our values once we’ve hit those limits.
Shipping faster will help Ethereum get there.
Instead of "should we do X or Y?", the answer might be "both."
item.dc:creator: @gakonst

item.title:
part of the problem with bloated software in crypto is that it is designed by committee trying to be unopinionated and satisfy everyone ahead of time vs a product-driven usecase and top down full stack decision making
love ecosystem wide collaboration on projects, but sometimes you just gotta hire the right team and do the whole thing e2e
item.dc:creator: @gakonst
item.description:

item.title: Has any AI agent framework integrated yet with account abstraction session keys for agents w/ true non-custodial wallets? DM me? You could easily map function calls API to session key scopes and do magic, and I might have some good tools to share with you.
item.dc:creator: @gakonst
item.description: Has any AI agent framework integrated yet with account abstraction session keys for agents w/ true non-custodial wallets? DM me? You could easily map function calls API to session key scopes and do magic, and I might have some good tools to share with you.
